Interface TicTacToe

All Known Implementing Classes:
TicTacToeModel
public interface TicTacToe
A single game of Tic Tac Toe, played on a three-by-three grid with two players, with the object of the game to achieve three markers in a row either vertically, horizontally, or diagonally. Player X goes first.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Player[][]
    getBoard()
    Return the current game state, as a 2D array of Player.
    Player
    getMarkAt(int r, int c)
    Return the current Player mark at a given row and column, or null if the position is empty.
    Player
    getTurn()
    Get the current turn, i.e., the player who will mark on the next call to move().
    Player
    getWinner()
    Return the winner of the game, or null if there is no winner.
    boolean
    isGameOver()
    Return whether the game is over.
    void
    move(int r, int c)
    Execute a move in the position specified by the given row and column.

  • Method Details

    • move

      void move(int r, int c)
      Execute a move in the position specified by the given row and column.
      Parameters:
      r - the row of the intended move
      c - the column of the intended move
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the space is occupied or the position is otherwise invalid
      IllegalStateException - if the game is over

    • getTurn

      Player getTurn()
      Get the current turn, i.e., the player who will mark on the next call to move().
      Returns:
      the Player whose turn it is

    • isGameOver

      boolean isGameOver()
      Return whether the game is over. The game is over when either the board is full, or one player has won.
      Returns:
      true if the game is over, false otherwise

    • getWinner

      Player getWinner()
      Return the winner of the game, or null if there is no winner. If the game is not over, returns null.
      Returns:
      the winner, or null if there is no winner

    • getBoard

      Player[][] getBoard()
      Return the current game state, as a 2D array of Player. A null value in the grid indicates an empty position on the board.
      Returns:
      the current game board

    • getMarkAt

      Player getMarkAt(int r, int c)
      Return the current Player mark at a given row and column, or null if the position is empty.
      Parameters:
      r - the row
      c - the column
      Returns:
      the player at the given position, or null if it's empty
